Case reference: 2014005172.CaseDesc: Debra Marlow was last seen in Kingston Ontario on November 3rd, 2008, where she had a mental health assessment at Kingston General Hospital. She was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001648.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1986, Gustave Focktave was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Côte-Des-Neiges-Notre-Dame-De-Grâce District of Montreal, Quebec. Gustave had left without his possessions and had left a farewell letter addressed to his family indicating that he would be hitchhiking to British Columbia to live in Vancouver. Gustave is originally from Madagascar.

Case reference: 2012020647.CaseDesc:
Ricky Riopel was reported missing in August 2010 by family members who had not seen or heard from him since December 2008. It was later established that he had been in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan at a health care facility in October 2009.  
 
The last confirmed sighting of Ricky was in Saskatoon, at a downtown shopping mall, in September 2010. His parents are both failing in health which has prompted this additional request for public assistance.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing top front tooth

Case reference: 2007004799.CaseDesc: Stacy Dilenardi was last seen on November 28, 2005, purchasing some cigarettes at a gas bar in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario (Garden River). He had just moved to Sault Ste. Marie and had recently started a job as a technician with the Ontario Forest Research Institute. Stacy had spoken to his father the day before his disappearance. On November 30, 2005, investigators located his vehicle north of the city on a snowmobile trail.

Case reference: 2021006090.CaseDesc: At the end of July, 2019, Jonathan Fowler was seen for the last time in Picton, Ontario. Since then, there has not been any activity on his banking, phone and social media accounts. During the time of his disappearance, Jonathan was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2014004801.CaseDesc: Beant Singh Khosa was last seen in Punjab, India on April 15th, 2006.  He travelled to India to attend his father's funeral and never returned.  It is rumored he has returned to Canada, however, his family and friends have not heard from him.

Case reference: 2014004763.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2005, Leslie Thompson was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Leslie is known as a gambler and frequents bars.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2024015856.CaseDesc: Janine was last seen on March 30, 2024, walking near Township Road 534 and Range Road 185, heading towards Mundare, Alberta.  Janine was known to hitchhike.

Case reference: 2014002223.CaseDesc: Edward Joseph Arcand left his residence in Coleman, Alberta on June 8, 1975, driving a 1969 Ford Falcon station wagon.  On June 15, 1975 his vehicle was found abandoned 80 km north of Coleman on highway 940.  Edward has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2021030112.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2021, Jeanette Marcotte was reported missing in Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette was last seen in Saskatchewan in 1981 or 1982, where she stated that she was headed to Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006023199.CaseDesc: Kenneth Churney was last seen in March of 1997. He was on a snowmobile travelling northbound toward the trail system head at the rear of Pine Crescent. He never returned from snowmobiling and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Deformity: Left Ring Finger, 0.5 of an inch shorter

Case reference: 2013000025.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1998, Darwin Sylvester was seen for the last time at approximately 23:00 hrs. He called his girlfriend shortly after midnight on May 29th. Darwin had plans to meet with an associate for breakfast, however he never showed for the meeting. His belongings and luggage were all located at the residence on Chalmers. He has not had any contact with friends or family since.

Tattoo: Left Arm, "Spartans MC in Memory of" (text)

Case reference: 2017040789.CaseDesc: In 2016, Samantha Fiddler left Canada to go to the state of Florida in the United States of America. Samantha was last known to be in the area of Bartow, Florida. Her family has not heard from her since November 2016.

Case reference: 2005002499.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1987, a black male was found on the shoreline of the Holly Bay Lodge (Lot 8, Con. 12, Dover Township) in Mitchell's Bay of Lake St. Clair, Wallaceburg. He may have been a smoker. He is believed to have been dead for approximately 8 months.

Money: coins, most recent 1985, distributed after March
Shoes: Blue, Grey, running shoes "Winner" brand, size 8 with velcro fasteners
Socks: Cotton, White, red and blue stripes at the top
Other: May have suffered from lower back pain

Case reference: 2009005299.CaseDesc: David Chevrier suffers from schizophrenia and functions at a low intellectual level. He was last seen at the Centre of Friends on Main street in North Bay.

Case reference: 2006021699.CaseDesc: Karl Anderson was last seen on September 3, 1974 in Upsala, Ontario. It was thought that he possibly travelled by train to Sioux Lookout or Thunder Bay to seek medical treatment.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2020006644.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1980, Andrew Jenkins was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Andrew may have been despondent.

Scar: Left Side Of Neck, Two inches

Case reference: 2023001230.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2023, John Michael Fongémie was last seen. Since that time, no bank transactions have been recorded, nor have any calls been made on his cell phone. Extensive searches for John Michael were conducted with no success.

Tattoo: Right Leg, Yin Yang symbol, yellow and blue
Upper Left Back, Two initials, possibly "G" and "J"

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2012020014.CaseDesc: Sharon Gayle Dawson was seen for the last time on Christmas day in 2010, when she left her home in Qualicum Beach on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. There is an unconfirmed report that she was seen on December 28, 2010 at the World Parrot Refuge near Coombs, B.C.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2009002399.CaseDesc: On Friday, April 21, 1972, Francis Harris went to a medical appointment with her husband in Peterborough. On the way home to Apsley, they stopped in Lakefield and she may have gone to the post office and the bank. They arrived home around 11:00 a.m. and ate lunch. Her husband went to work from approximately 1:00 p.m. to 5:05 p.m.  When their son returned home from school at about 3:40 p.m., Mrs. Harris was not home.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Wavy, may have been dyed black
Ring: White gold engagement and wedding ring

Case reference: 2014004358.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2003 Rahul Arora was last seen leaving the Trappers Inn in Parry Sound, Ontario.  He was possibly heading to the Toronto area to catch a flight.

Hair: Black, Straight, Ear length, parted in middle, dyed copper

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014002923.CaseDesc: On March 27, 1998 Jacqueline Olynyk was observed to be walking by the Red River in Winnipeg, MB.  Miss Olynyk has not been heard from or seen since that day.

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, Saskatchewan, on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000138.CaseDesc: Peter Limberis was last seen in Trail BC on July 20, 2005. He left Trail on his way to Saskatchewan, driving in his white 2003 Saturn Vue with Saskatchewan licence plate 850ENA. Mr. Limberis was also travelling with his dog, a white and brown smooth haired Fox Terrier named Pedro.

Chain: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, chain
Pants: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Track
Shirt: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Jersey
Watch: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Jail house noose

Case reference: 2014006256.CaseDesc: Christopher Maier lives in Saskatoon and traveled to Regina, Saskatchewan in December 1994 to visit family and friends. He was believed to have returned to Saskatoon after his visit, although this has not been confirmed. Christopher has not been seen since and was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 18, 2013.

Pierce: Ears, He had one piercing in his right ear.
Scar: Forehead, The scar was L shaped. No actual size of the scar is available.

Case reference: 2012020032.CaseDesc: Lorilee Francis was last known to be in Grande Prairie, Alberta. She has not been heard from by family or friends since approximately October of 2007.

Case reference: 2016066066.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2016, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Kevin Dilk was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Kevin has not been seen or heard from since this time.

Case reference: 2014005326.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1972, Edmonton Police Service members found a purse and identification belonging to Eunice Antoniuk on the walkway of the High Level Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. A note addressed to her family was found within the purse. All police searches were negative and Eunice has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020008724.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1979, Irvin Lasinskas was last seen at the Wellesley Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Irvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004602.CaseDesc: Denis Gelinas left his home in Notre-Dame-Du-Mont-Carmel on the morning of December 31, 1993 and was never seen again.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Snake and a dagger

Case reference: 2006022499.CaseDesc: Witold Sagin was last seen while fishing on Gordon Lake. He was fishing in a canoe, which was later found overturned. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002890.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1983, Bertha Kolachynski was last seen at her residence in the community of Chippawa in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Bertha was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001323.CaseDesc: Mary Kreiser was last seen on September 16 1987 at the Petro Canada gas station in Westlock, Alberta.  She has not been heard from since October 1987. It is believed that Mary may be in the Vancouver, British Columbia area.

Case reference: 1987203340.CaseDesc: Joanne Pedersen went missing on February 19, 1983, near her home at Vedder Crossing (Chilliwack). She was last seen with an adult male at a telephone booth.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005378.CaseDesc: On September 8, 2004, Robert Harrington was last seen near the intersection of Oakwood Avenue and Vaughan Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2011002999.CaseDesc: Donald Pringle was last seen on August 28, 2010. Donald takes medication and when he is not on his medication he becomes agitated and aggressive and makes poor decisions. Donald last had his medication on August 27. All family and friends have been interviewed and no one has seen or heard from Donald. He was last seen walking on Great Northern Road by Second Line East on August 28, 2010 at 2 pm.  At the time Donald was not carrying anything with him and was alone.

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar

Case reference: 2012020012.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Surtel was last seen April 28, 2007 at his residence in Mission, BC. Jeff is believed to have left his home riding a distinctive blue CCM mountain bike with yellow forks.

Case reference: 2018034585.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2004, at approximately 8:00 am, Stephen Lawrence was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Stephen had said he would be home in a few hours.

Shirt: Blue, Brand: Calvin Klein; long sleeves

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2012020115.CaseDesc: Glen Moquin was last seen at a summer camp in Abitibi on August 9th, 1993.  His clothes were located on the shore of the lake.

Case reference: 2007001599.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Robert St. Louis was seen for the last time when left his home in the Laval-Ouest district in Laval, Quebec. Robert left without his wallet and truck keys. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014002159.CaseDesc: Jason Misurko was last known to be in Fort McMurray, Alberta on September 17, 1995. There have been no sightings or contact since then. His vehicle was later recovered in Enderby, B.C.

Case reference: 2006012199.CaseDesc: Leonel Phillips left Butterfield Lodge by boat to travel on Lake Matinenda (Blind River, Ontario) to Log Chateau. Mr. Phillips' boat was located adrift but he was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Scar: Chest, A burn scar below his right breast

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday 19 June 2008. Jennifer was last seen leaving Grand Rapids at approximately 12:00 p.m. en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels, it is believed that she was dropped off near the junction of Waterhen - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Jennifer has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006008499.CaseDesc: Anthony Huss was last seen November 08, 1975 leaving the Bon Aire Motel. He indicated that he was travelling to Chapleau. His vehicle was located, abandoned in a bush area near Smokey Falls, Kipling Township, District of Cochrane. Mr. Huss has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2019050942.CaseDesc: On August 16, 2019, Aaron Wuttunee was seen for the last time in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. During the time of his disappearance, Aaron had mentioned to an acquaintance that he may hitchhike to Edmonton, Alberta. There is also a possibility that he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia, but it has not been confirmed. Aaron is known for leading a transient lifestyle, and suffered from a brain injury that causes short term memory loss and makes him prone to falling.

Case reference: 2024015700.CaseDesc: Guy Pyke left his residence in Syracuse, NY, at approximately 3pm on April 2,1999, in a 1989 dark blue Chevy Blazer with NY plate FMS 867. Shortly after Guy was seen in the vicinity of the 2000 block of State Route 11 in the Evan Mills, NY area. Guy has family in Brockville, Ontario, and mentioned wanting to visit them however due to the state of his dementia it is believed he could’ve become lost in his travels.

Case reference: 2014000003.CaseDesc: The Toronto Police Service is seeking assistance in solving a missing person case.  Mr. Sandhu left his home located in the North West area of Toronto in February of 2004 and never returned.  His family is desperately seeking answers.  Please contact the Toronto Police Service with any information that may assist in locating Mr. Sandhu.

Jacket: Cotton, Black, waist length; zippered front
Scar: Nose, Small scar on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014002824.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1985, Sidney Manning was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. On July 17, 1985, Sydney departed from Cultus Lake, B.C. in his brown 1984 Oldsmobile. On August 4, 1985, his vehicle was located abandoned on a forest service road in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2022006217.CaseDesc: On February 14, 2022, Jessie Morrissey's mother reported him missing from Amherst, Nova Scotia.  Jessie was last seen travelling in a dark-coloured Jeep Patriot in the Springhill area on the morning of February 13. The Jeep Patriot he was travelling in was located on snowmobile Trail 104 in Leamington, Nova Scotia later that evening.

Case reference: 2021047956.CaseDesc: Gerald Smith was last seen in July 2021 in Whitemouth, Manitoba when it was believed he left alone on a fishing trip. At the time of his disappearance, Smith was discouraged following a medical diagnosis.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Metal pins and plates

Case reference: 2019071976.CaseDesc: In September of 2012, Donald Watson was last seen by his mother, and his family has had no contact with him since this time. Donald is transient in nature and usually travels on foot as transportation. Canada Border Services Agency’s last documentation of Donald was in 2013 when he entered Laredo, Texas in the United States from Mexico as a pedestrian.

Case reference: 2019015560.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2019, Donna Paré was reported missing in Montreal, Quebec. Donna last communicated with her family in December 2018, and is known to live a transient lifestyle. She is known to frequent the Berri-UQAM and Place-des-Arts metro stations, and the McDonald’s on Sainte-Catherine Street East and Berri Park in Montreal, Quebec. Donna’s family has reason to fear for her health and safety.

Case reference: 2020012524.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1993, at approximately 2:45pm, Lois Dunlavy was seen for the last time as she attended the Scarborough General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. Lois had been examined by a physician and when the physician returned to check on her, she was gone.

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: On January 20, 1983, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Tania Murrell was seen for the last time as she left school to return home.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2014003425.CaseDesc: Christopher Giberson, went missing from the Saint John Regional Hospital on Friday, January 28th, 2000, at 7:00 p.m. where he was taken for treatment and then assessment, but he walked away before being seen by staff.

Case reference: 2017076317.CaseDesc: Dakota Anzovino was last seen on December 23, 2017, in the City of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Boots: Tan, Black, Winter, Brand: "Sorel"; with white fur
Jacket: Black, Grey, Plaid with dark hood
Jeans: Denim, Grey, Light Blue, Or grey in colour

Case reference: 2023008747.CaseDesc: Joseph Lamartina was last seen on December 16th, 2018 when he checked out of a hotel in Niagara Falls, New York. His abandoned vehicle was located in the parking of the hotel on February 8th, 2019. He has not been heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Chain, With gold Sicilian horn
Gold, Gold, Chain, With St-Christopher medallion

Case reference: 2014001288.CaseDesc: On November 9th, 1993, Violet Zarb was observed leaving her residence in Port Colborne, Ontario, shortly after 8:30 AM. Her vehicle was located on Clifton Hill, Niagara Falls, Ontario the next day.  Violet's whereabouts remain unknown to this date. At the time of her disappearance, Violet was possibly wearing a black leather jacket and blue jeans.

Case reference: 2014004632.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 2005, Dean Phillips  was reported missing by his family in Campbell River, British Columbia. Dean was  last seen at a local school in Campbell River and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004400.CaseDesc: Deoclides Santos was last seen on November 27, 2003, in Kitchener, Ontario, by his son.

Case reference: 2014004950.CaseDesc: On June 5, 2007, Kim Rogelstad was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Kim's family has not seen or heard from her since May 27, 2007.

Case reference: 2014004138.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2002, Sefacag Erdinc was last seen at his residence in Mission, British Columbia. Since then, Mr. Erdinc has not been seen or heard from.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Moon and Star

Case reference: 2020007826.CaseDesc: Gerhart Kiel was reported missing from his residence in Minburn, Alberta. His vehicle, a dark grey 2009 Ford Ranger which has a truck bed cover in the same colour, was also reported missing from his residence. Gerhart has not had any contact with his family since November 23, 2019.

Case reference: 2014002675.CaseDesc: Richard Monroe was last seen on October 2nd, 2001 by the owners of Serge's Restaurant on Elgin Street in the city of Greater Sudbury. Richard is believed to have suffered from dementia. He spent most of his time in Thessalon, Sault Ste. Marie, Dunn's Valley, Sudbury and British Columbia.

Case reference: 2018053584.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1996, at approximately 1:30 p.m., Esther Adam was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Esther had made arrangements to meet with a friend on May 18, at 10:00 a.m., but did not attend.

Mark: Nose, Blue mark on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2006012299.CaseDesc: On June 02, 1984, Andrew Grinnell, his brother,their cousin and a friend  departed Sioux Lookout on a canoe trip on the Albany River. The party arrived in Fort Albany on July 18, 1984. At 6:00 p.m. that same day, the party decided to leave Fort Albany in an attempt to paddle to Moosonee via James Bay. The group had planned to go out onto James Bay with the tide and sail to Moosonee by lashing their canoes together. An intense storm engulfed the James Bay coastal area on July 23, 1984, and it is likely that the party perished on the Bay during this storm. Three victims were recovered in August 1984, twelve nautical miles North of the Moose River. Mr. Grinnell's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2023064175.CaseDesc: Hao Luo, better known as Helen to her family and friends, left her home in the community of Glenwood in Winnipeg, Manitoba, on November 22, 2023. Helen was feeling despondent at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large

Case reference: 2014005011.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2005, at approximately 6:15 p.m., Senekinesh Qirma was seen for the last time at the Eaton Centre in Toronto, Ontario. Senekinesh was in Canada on a visitor’s visa.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2012020106.CaseDesc: Danielle Boisvert, 18 years old, disappeared November 6, 1979. On that day, Danielle was last seen leaving a bar in Montreal-North, Québec.

Case reference: 2012020088.CaseDesc: Norbert Couillonneur was last seen on Thursday, May 27, 2010, at Pinehouse Lake, SK, wearing blue jeans and a light blue t-shirt. He is known to travel back and forth from Pinehouse Lake to Canoe Lake, SK.

Case reference: 2014005249.CaseDesc: Peter Cory Butler was reported missing by family on March 24, 2008. He was last seen in downtown Whitecourt, AB on March 15, 2008.

Case reference: 2014002843.CaseDesc: A party of 6 men departed Churchill, Manitoba, on a fishing trip traveling in three canoes. On June 20, 1967, two of the three canoes became stranded on mud flats at a point where the Hayes and Nelson Rivers empty into the Hudson Bay. The men made camp for the night and then the following day Kurt Hild, Ronald Davidson and James Cochrane all attempted to retrieve the stranded canoes. On return to the camp the men were confronted with high winds and freezing rain which forced them out of sight. None of the remains of the men have been recovered. Foul play is not suspected in the matter.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014004820.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2006, William Teya was seen for the last time in Fort McPherson, Northwest Territories.

Jacket: Black, Dark; E. Gruben Transport on left chest

Case reference: 2014006338.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1988, George Burke was last seen by his wife, when he left their residence in Edmonton, Alberta, to take the bus to work. That day, George did not arrive at work, and it is unknown whether he caught the bus.

Case reference: 2014006393.CaseDesc: In June 2002, Edward Decoyne was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Edward has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006557.CaseDesc: Alvin Berg, 35 years old, was originally from the Pierceland District, SK. He was working as a farm labourer in the Spinney Hill district near Maymont, SK. Mr. Berg was last seen when he left this farm in October of 1940, after which he had no further contact with his family.

Case reference: 2013000005.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2009, Jody Hockett was reported missing to the Grande Prairie RCMP in Alberta. Jody had been attending a party at a friend's apartment on February 22, 2009. She left the party and was expected to return.  She was last seen getting into an older, white car in downtown Grande Prairie sometime later that night or in the early morning hours of February 23, 2009. Jody was known to lead a high-risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Buttocks, Heart Symbol on left side
Left Hip, Red heart with initials

Case reference: 2012020134.CaseDesc: On the morning of September 4, 2002, Edward Taylor left his residence and took his vehicle to go to work. He has not been seen since. His car was found on September 7, 2002 in a service area of Porte-du-Nord, which is located on the Laurentides highway between Saint-Jérôme and Saint-Sauveur in Quebec.

Shirt: Dark Blue, Long sleeve shirt, navy blue
